intro: Scorzonera pulchra, commonly known as the showy scorzonera, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers with dark centers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its tuberous roots are edible and have been historically used in traditional medicine. Scorzonera pulchra thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
